message: Use cryptographic random numbers generators for anything even close to a security function.
source: Do not use weak/non-cryptographic random number generators
replacement: Replacements depend on language.

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to strcpy_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: strcpy is frequently dangerous, as it will cause a buffer overflow if the source is larger than the destination.
replacement: Use strcpy_s or strlcpy if possible. If no safe function is viable, strcpy/strncpy should be proceeded by conditional checks to verify tha that the source string will fit in the destination with a null termnator.

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to strcpy_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: strncpy is dangerous, as if the source contains 'n' or more characters, it will not null terminate the destination.
replacement: Use strcpy_s or strlcpy if possible. If no safe function is viable, strcpy/strncpy should be proceeded by conditional checks to verify tha that the source string will fit in the destination with a null termnator.

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to strcat_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: If the combination of strings is larger than the destination buffer, strcat will cbuffer overflow the destination buffer
replacement: Use strcat_s or strlcat if possible. strncat's size parameter excludes the null terminator, which leads to frequent mistakes

fixes.text: strlcat(dest,  "this is also bad",  sizeof dest)
strcat_s(dest,  sizeof dest,  "this is also bad")
fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to strcat_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: strncat adds the null terminator at character 'n + 1', rather than at the nth character. this frequently leads to the null terminator being added in the memory adjacent to the destination buffer, rather than in the destination buffer.
replacement: Use strcat_s or strlcat if possible.

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to gets_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: gets will read in as many bytes as are provided, regardless of the size of buffer recieving the bytes.  This allows for conditions that cause a buffer overlow in the destination buffer.
replacement: Use gets_s or fgets if possible. fgets has different behavior from gets (may include newline for example), so care should be taken if it is used.

replacement: Replacements depend on language.

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to gets_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: gets will read in as many bytes as are provided, regardless of the size of buffer recieving the bytes.  This allows for conditions that cause a buffer overlow in the destination buffer.
replacement: Use gets_s or fgets if possible. fgets has different behavior from gets (may include newline for example), so care should be taken if it is used.

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: HTML Entity encode the data

message: When using $_GET/POST/COOKIE values via echo, failure to  encode the values will lead to Cross Site Scription (XSS), where a malicious party can inject script into the webpage.
source: XSS: Do not echo unencoded GET/POST/COOKIE values
replacement: HTML Entity Encode (for content going into HTML) or URL Encode (for content going into JavaScript variables) the data

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: HTML Entity encode the data

message: When using $_GET/POST/COOKIE values via echo, failure to  encode the values will lead to Cross Site Scription (XSS), where a malicious party can inject script into the webpage.
source: XSS: Do not echo unencoded GET/POST/COOKIE values
replacement: HTML Entity Encode (for content going into HTML) or URL Encode (for content going into JavaScript variables) the data

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to strcpy_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: strcpy is frequently dangerous, as it will cause a buffer overflow if the source is larger than the destination.
replacement: Use strcpy_s or strlcpy if possible. If no safe function is viable, strcpy/strncpy should be proceeded by conditional checks to verify tha that the source string will fit in the destination with a null termnator.

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to strcpy_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: strncpy is dangerous, as if the source contains 'n' or more characters, it will not null terminate the destination.
replacement: Use strcpy_s or strlcpy if possible. If no safe function is viable, strcpy/strncpy should be proceeded by conditional checks to verify tha that the source string will fit in the destination with a null termnator.

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to strcat_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: If the combination of strings is larger than the destination buffer, strcat will cbuffer overflow the destination buffer
replacement: Use strcat_s or strlcat if possible. strncat's size parameter excludes the null terminator, which leads to frequent mistakes

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to strcat_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: strncat adds the null terminator at character 'n + 1', rather than at the nth character. this frequently leads to the null terminator being added in the memory adjacent to the destination buffer, rather than in the destination buffer.
replacement: Use strcat_s or strlcat if possible.

fixes.fixName: DevSkim: Change to gets_s (Recommended for VC++)

message: gets will read in as many bytes as are provided, regardless of the size of buffer recieving the bytes.  This allows for conditions that cause a buffer overlow in the destination buffer.
replacement: Use gets_s or fgets if possible. fgets has different behavior from gets (may include newline for example), so care should be taken if it is used.
